about.label: About Us
about.intro: ARCAN Transactions SA is a company specialized in real estate investment in Switzerland.
about.text1: We operate exclusively in the institutional and professional segment, working in direct connection with key players in the real estate market.
about.text2: We advise and support property owners, investors, pension funds, family offices, and developers in the sale, acquisition, and structuring of real estate transactions.

process.label: The Sales Processes
process.title: Rigorous control of sales processes to

hero.label: Methodology
hero.description: Arcan Transactions SA manages the entire sales process with the objective of maximizing the sale price of the asset, whether through a direct sale or a competitive bidding process, structured as an Asset Deal (direct property sale), Share Deal (sale of the owning company), or a sale and leaseback transaction.

mandate.description: The type of mandate defines the framework of our collaboration and the scope of our involvement in the sale of your property.

simple.title: Non-Exclusive Mandate
simple.description: The owner may appoint several intermediaries simultaneously. This structure offers greater flexibility but may limit the level of commitment and investment from each advisor.

exclusive.title: Exclusive Mandate
exclusive.description: Arcan Transactions SA acts as the sole intermediary appointed for the sale of the property. This exclusivity allows us to deploy all our resources and ensure a fully controlled, consistent, and optimized approach.

directSale.label: Methodology
directSale.description: A targeted and confidential approach for fast and well-controlled transactions. Ideal for owners seeking discretion and speed.

exclusive.title: Exclusive
exclusive.description: The asset is presented to a single prospective buyer at a fixed price. The transaction is completed only if the price is accepted, ensuring full confidentiality.

selective.title: Selective
selective.description: The asset is offered at a fixed price to several qualified investors. The principle is straightforward: the first investor to offer the asking price secures the deal ('first in, first served').

timeline.title: Timeline
timeline.label: Process & Timing
steps: Selection of one or more investor(s)
Receipt of signed NDAs & opening of the short data room
Receipt of NBOs & opening of the full data room
Receipt of binding offers (BOs) and acceptance
Review of the draft notarial deed

callForTenders.label: Methodology
callForTenders.description: A structured process designed to maximize value through competition. Recommended for assets with strong market potential.

selective.title: Selective
selective.description: For highly specific assets, it is appropriate to limit the circle of potential investors to a carefully selected group.

open.title: Open
open.description: For assets in high demand, the investor universe is opened as widely as possible in order to create competition and optimize the sale price.

timeline.title: Timeline
timeline.label: Process & Timing
steps: Receipt of signed NDAs & distribution of the Information Memorandum
Receipt of NBOs, shortlist selection & opening of the full data room
Receipt of binding offers (BOs) & award of the transaction
Review of the draft notarial deed

assetDeal.title: Asset Deal
assetDeal.subtitle: Direct property sale
assetDeal.p1: In an Asset Deal, the property itself is sold.
assetDeal.p2: A direct property sale involves lower risk for the investor, as only risks directly related to the property are transferred to the buyer.
assetDeal.p3: Transaction costs (notary fees, land registry fees, transfer taxes) are borne by the buyer, in accordance with standard market practice.

shareDeal.title: Share Deal
shareDeal.subtitle: Sale of the owning company
shareDeal.p1: In a Share Deal, the shares of the company owning the property are sold.
shareDeal.p2: A corporate sale offers financial and tax advantages for both the seller and the buyer. However, it requires a more in-depth due diligence, as the buyer assumes all risks related to the company's historical liabilities.

saleLeaseback.title: Sale & Leaseback
saleLeaseback.subtitle: Sale and leaseback transaction
saleLeaseback.p1: A sale and leaseback transaction may be structured either as an Asset Deal or a Share Deal.
saleLeaseback.p2: In this specific scenario, the owner sells the property while remaining as tenant. The key consideration is to determine which option is most advantageous for the client: maximizing the sale price or, conversely, optimizing the lease terms.

legal.purposeText: The holding, purchase, sale, administration, management, rental, brokerage, operation, and property management of real estate, as well as the promotion and management of real estate projects and the granting of loans and guarantees to shareholders or third parties. The company may carry out, either on its own behalf or on behalf of third parties, all financial, commercial, movable or real estate operations directly or indirectly related to its corporate purpose and may participate, in any form, in any similar enterprises. The company may also establish branches and subsidiaries in Switzerland and abroad.
legal.privacyIntro: Arcan Transactions SA attaches great importance to protecting your privacy. This privacy policy explains how we collect, use and protect your personal data, in accordance with the Swiss Federal Data Protection Act (FADP) and, where applicable, the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).
legal.dataCollectionText: We only collect personal data that you voluntarily provide to us, particularly through our contact form or by email (name, surname, email address, phone number). This data is necessary to respond to your requests and provide our services.
legal.dataUsageText: Your data is used exclusively within the framework of our business relationship. It is never sold to third parties. We may share certain information with trusted service providers (hosting, IT maintenance) only to the extent necessary for the performance of their duties.
legal.cookiesText: This site may use cookies to improve your browsing experience and analyze traffic (anonymous statistics). You can configure your browser to refuse cookies.
